comment._content: I could not find a Medal Index card listed at the National Archive for a Captain T Adamson of the Highland Light Infantry. I could not find one for a Major either - just in case he'd been promoted before he'd entered a Theatre of War. What I could find was a card for a Captain F J Adamson, 12th Battalion Highland Light Infantry which is held under reference WO 372/1/20446. discovery.nationalarchives.gov.uk/SearchUI/Details?uri=D1.... He had initially been a Second Lieutenant. Could therefore be a typo - either on the card or the name associated with this photograph. There was also a 2nd Lieutenant George Adamson who died at Loos in 1915 while serving with the 12th Battalion HLI. www.cwgc.org/find-war-dead/casualty/726358/ADAMSON,%20GEORGE

comment._content: This could well be the prewar Scottish chaplain of the United Free Church - The Reverend Thomas Adamson, D.D., late Acting Chaplain, Scottish Command, Glasgow Companies, Royal Army Medical Corps (Volunteers) The London Gazette, October 15, 1909, p. 7568 www.london-gazette.co.uk/issues/28297/pages/7568/page.pdf
